caption.title: The minima of the combined KL information distance (KL3) as a function of the infectious period ( d I) and the basic reproductive number ( R 0).
caption.p: For each pair of d I and R 0, the best fit parameters were searched over the following space, ϕ: [1,7] gridded evenly into 71 points, ψ: [0,1] gridded evenly into 21 points and D: [1,10] years gridded evenly into 21 points. It is assumed that the co-transmission rate β d = β/4 and the external force of infection ( ε) is fixed at 4.1×10 −9 per person per day. A) shows that there is a positive correlation between d I and R 0: when R 0 is about 1.5, d I is <2.1 day; whilst when R 0 = 2.5 d I should be <3.5 days. B) shows that the immunity period decreases with d I but increases with R 0; C) shows that for a given R 0, infectivity enhancement ( ϕ) required to generate the observed patterns of seasonal influenza decreases with d I; D) shows that cross-immunity increases with d I but decreases with R 0.
